Below is the error that I'm receiving.  I was not having this problem w/ M5

Hi Kyle,
What did you transfer from M5? Did you copy the entire workspace (including
metadata)? We don't officially support workspace migration yet, but looking at
the code it looks like the server is ok, but the runtime (or it's link to the
server) is missing.

Can you go to Preferences > Server > Installed Runtimes and see if your runtime
is still listed? If it is, then please open up the Tomcat server editor from the
Servers view and check whether the runtime setting points to that runtime. If
you create a new runtime and/or switch the server to use it, it should allow the
server to publish again.

Deferring this bug post 0.7 since it appears to be a configuration issue with a
previous workspace and should not happen to newly created servers.

Tim, would this be better closed as "won't fix", with 1) stated workaround of
deleting server and re-creating? and 2) promising to be careful with migration
in the future? :) 

I've just sort of scanned this issue, but seems we are not planning any action
for this particular "blocking" bug since is now history? 

(And, Kyle, you could re-open or open a new one if you continue to see trouble?).

Tim,

I was able to rebuild my workspace and am no longer having this issue.  So, I
believe you were correct in that it was an upgrade issue.

Thanks,
Kyle

(In reply to comment #1)

Hi David,
At the very least I'll be using this bug to fix the NPEs above. No matter what
has happened to the workspace, I'd rather there is was an error message and no
internal problems.
NPE fixed and dropped for next I-build.
Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months. If this problem has not been verified or you still have problems, please open a new bug.
